metadata.synopsis: Astarion discuss Cazador before procceeding to Wyrm's Crossing or after entering it.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Baldur's Gate is right over the hills. And so is Cazador...

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: Cazador and his Rite of Profane Ascension. An imperious soiree, attended by devils and spawn alike...

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: A grand ceremony to honour one exalted vampiric master, and elevate him to an unfathomable station.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: To place him in a position of such esteem the world will yearn to kneel and offer their necks.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: It sounds as if you envy him...

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Of course I envy him. Why wouldn't I?

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: The problem with what Cazador has done is that he did it to me.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Not a bad place to be.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Then you've been thinking the same thing.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: We need to stop him. Yesterday.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: We will kill him, but there's more to it. Think about it. It sounds like Cazador, for all his evils, has gotten further than any of my kind ever have. He's on the verge of a miracle.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: If the time comes, and I can stay one move ahead of him, I'll take his place before his blood can hit the floor.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: So you'd kill to take that power from him? The others bound to the ritual?

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: What's a handful of the wretch's servants? If they're anything like me when I was enslaved, they're all but begging for death anyway.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I don't know. Raphael said the Ascension was lethally diabolical.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Doesn't it sound delightful? For the lucky little vampire on the winning side?

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: After two hundred years of shit, pure shit, I think I deserve something better.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: All that matters to me is that you're safe.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: I know you do. It matters to me, as well. I want to be able to protect you, too.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Look, I appreciate that. Very grateful, of course.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Freedom is not the same as power.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: A killer isn't worthy of respect.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: You're wrong. You've clearly never been in a place where you had nothing but shame and fear.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. We don't even know if that's possible.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: All I'm saying is: let's be clever about it. If an opportunity arises for me to become a more magnificent bastard than I already am, why turn it down?

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: Let's find out more about the ritual before we waltz into Cazador's front door.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: If we track down my old comrades - the other spawn - we may discover more... and be finely positioned for yours truly to ascend.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: As long as you're sure you'll be all right seeing them again, love.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: You're too adorable. I'll be fine. I'm sure they'll bring back memories of so many pathetic years, but I'm much stronger now.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: If we don't find my brethren, they will find us. Likely with bared fangs.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: We should get to them first, then we can make their pretty tongues talk.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'm with you all the way.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: My, my. You sweetheart. Then there isn't a moment to waste.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. We don't even know if it's possible for you to usurp the ritual.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: We're going to Baldur's Gate. The city of one-in-a-million chances, splendour and squalor. Anything could happen.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Well, the information will be useful. We'll find the other spawn.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I promise to help you stop Cazador. I won't promise anything else.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: We'll be glorious both, you and I. You'll have your day, too.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: If we can pull it off... we hardly know anything about the ritual.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Do you think we can defeat him? Are we strong enough?

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: This may be a beginning, not an end. I can see myself now. Lord, King, Master.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: And we are no closer to knowing why that bastard is so obsessed with getting me back.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I think we should track down my fellow spawn. I'm not exactly looking forward to a reunion, but perhaps they'll know something.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: If we find them, we can force them to tell us what he's been doing since I was gone.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: And, honestly, I imagine they'll be coming for me in the night if I don't.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Where would the other spawn be?

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: Unless Cazador has changed their orders, they'll be in the dens of this town, seeking prey.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'd rather avoid any more vampires.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: Oh, they'll be here for you, too.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: I know, I'm a real delight. But we're in danger, and we will have to face the other spawn at some point.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: We will kill him, no matter what.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm sorry we don't know more.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: Who was the one who thwarted the deal with Raphael, hmm?

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: To tell you the truth, I don't know whether we can defeat Cazador. Not unless we figure out more about what he's plotting.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: The Gate is close... as is Cazador.
